identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy of Symbicort® pMDI, With or Without Spacer, in Children (6-11 Years) With Asthma
identificationModule.officialTitle: A 4-week, Open-label, Randomized, Multi-centre, Parallel-group Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of 4 Actuations Symbicort® (Budesonide/Formoterol) HFA pMDI 40/2.25 μg Twice Daily, With and Without Spacer, in Children (6-11 Years) With Asthma

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the study is to compare Symbicort pMDI with and without spacer in terms of steroid potency, improvement of lung function and asthma symptoms in children with asthma (6-11 years).

primaryOutcomes.description: Ratio between the value at the end of treatment and the value at start of treatment, including only patients with values at both baseline and end of treatment

secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in FEV1 from baseline to the mean value at 2 weeks to 4 weeks with the baseline value as a covariate.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At baseline, at 2 weeks and 4 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in average value from the run-in to the treatment period, calculated using all available data for the 10 last days of run-in, and all available data after randomisation.Missing data between the first and last entry were estimated using linear interpolation.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Daily during run-in and daily during treatment period of 6 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in average value from the run-in to the treatment period, calculated using all available data for the 10 last days of run-in, and all available data after randomisation. Missing data between the first and last entry were estimated using linear interpolation.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Daily during run-in and daily during treatment period of 6 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in average value from the run-in to treatment period, calculated using all available data for the 10 last days of run-in, and all available data after randomisation.Missing data between the first and last entry estimated using linear interpolation. Daily scale:0 = No symptoms; 1 = Mild symptoms; 2 = Moderate symptoms; 3 = Severe symptoms.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Daily during run-in and daily during treatment period of 6 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Daily during run-in and daily during treatment period of 6 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Nights With Awakenings Due to Asthma
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in Percentage of nights with awakenings, average value from the run-in to treatment period, calculated using all available data for the 10 last days of run-in, and all available data after randomisation.Missing data between the first and last entry estimated using linear interpolation.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Daily during run-in and daily during treatment period of 6 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in average value from the run-in to treatment period, calculated using all available data for the 10 last days of run-in, and all available data after randomisation.Missing data between the first and last entry estimated using linear interpolation.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Daily during run-in and daily during treatment period of 6 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in average value from the run-in to treatment period, calculated using all available data for the 10 last days of run-in, and all available data after randomisation.Missing data between the first and last entry estimated using linear interpolation.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* children 6-11 years, diagnosed asthma treated
* 6 months, PEF
* 50% of predicted normal value pre-bronchodilator

Exclusion Criteria:

* current systemic glucocorticosteroids usage
* current respiratory infection
* any significant disease or disorder as judged by investigator

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: 137 subjects enrolled; 30 non randomised: 26 failed inclusion criteria, 2 voluntary discontinuations, 1 incorrect enrolment, 1 adverse event. 107 subjects were randomised

outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: At baseline, at 2 weeks and 4 weeks
